item.title: [GROOVY-10701] NullPointerException in instruction selection phase when having conditionals with lambdas and function references
item.description:
I have the following program

import java.util.function.Function;

class Test {
    <T> void m1(Function<T, T> x) {}

    double m2(double x) {
        return x;
    }

    void m3() {
        m1((true) ? (Double x) -> x : this::m2);
    }
}

comments.comment:
I can replicate on master but on the GROOVY_4_0_X branch the compiler doesn't crash but compilation fails with:

[Static type checking] - Cannot find matching method Test#m1(java.io.Serializable). Please check if the declared type is correct and if the method exists.

The static type checker has worked out that the branches of m1((true) ? (Double x) -> x : this::m2); are Closure<Double>. Then checkForTargetType leaves typeOfFalse as-is and changes typeOfTrue to Double. After that the LUB is computed as (Serializeable or ...).

    public void visitTernaryExpression(final TernaryExpression expression) {
        ...
        Expression trueExpression = expression.getTrueExpression();
        ClassNode typeOfTrue = findCurrentInstanceOfClass(trueExpression, null);
        trueExpression.visit(this);
        if (typeOfTrue == null) typeOfTrue = getType(trueExpression);
        typeCheckingContext.popTemporaryTypeInfo(); // instanceof doesn't apply to false branch
        Expression falseExpression = expression.getFalseExpression();
        falseExpression.visit(this);
        ClassNode typeOfFalse = getType(falseExpression);

        ClassNode resultType;
        ...
        } else {
            typeOfFalse = checkForTargetType(falseExpression, typeOfFalse);
            typeOfTrue = checkForTargetType(trueExpression, typeOfTrue);
            resultType = lowestUpperBound(typeOfTrue, typeOfFalse);
